comments:
I am adding a series of objects (6) to the tree using Display.syncExec and 3 of the objects are consistently not displayed in the TreeViewer, recieving the exception pasted below.  The TreeViewer has a customized ViewerSorter [org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ViewerSorter] set.  When the sorter is removed from the viewer, or replaced with an un-customized viewer, the exception no longer occurs.  An example of the customized viewer is pasted below as well:

------

TreeViewer.setSorter(new ViewerSorter(){
            public int category(Object element) {
                if (element instanceof StatusDisplay) {
                    return 0;
                } else if (element instanceof ObjectType1) {
                    return 1;
                } else if (element instanceof ObjectType2) {
                    return 2;
                } else if (element instanceof ObjectType3) {
                    return 3;
                } else
                    return 10;
            }
        });
